text:
League 1
OM: the Marseillais can not do it anymore!
Olympique de Marseille has lost these last two games, the last counted for the 16th round of the League Cup against AS Monaco on a score of 2-1 after the slap received by the PSG at Parc des Princes ( 4-0), three days ago.
01 Nov 2019, 13:20 by Nils Constant



Predrag RajkoviÄ‡ - ReimsAs every day of the championship, several individualities have distinguished themselves in Ligue 1. Discover the team-type of the weekend of the redaction.Icon Sport



Mohamed Simakan - StrasbourgIcon Sport



Thiago Silva - Paris Saint-GermainIcon Sport



Pablo Martinez - NÃ®mesIcon Sport



Ludovic Baal - BrestIcon Sport



Marco Verratti - Paris Saint-GermainIcon Sport



Paul Lasne - BrestIcon Sport



Angel Di Maria - Paris Saint-GermainIcon Sport



Yusuf YazÄ±cÄ± - LilleIcon Sport



Mauro Icardi - Paris Saint-GermainIcon Sport



Wissam Ben Yedder - MonacoIcon Sport

Simakan, Di Maria, Yazici, ... The typical team of the weekend in Ligue 1!




Marseille shines with its inability to get out of the water and restart the season. Nested after eleven days in the 7th place with a delay of eleven points on the leading PSG, the men of Andre Villas Boas touch the bottom.




Disturbing statistics




Marseille + 11 ğŸ“·Credit Photo - Icon Sport

The heavy defeat at the Parc did not touch the pride of Marseille who failed to bounce back against Monaco this week, eliminated from their entry into the league in the league. With just four wins and three defeats in Ligue 1, the Phocaeans are struggling to win games outside the league: in the last eleven out-league games, no win has been recorded. In the red, OM welcome Lille at Stade VÃ©lodrome this Saturday hoping to overcome this mediocrity in the game, provided since the beginning of the season.
